etymology.description: 入(入) (rù, "enter") - an arrowhead indicating the action of entering.
etymology.interpretation: The character 入 visually represents the concept of entering, akin to an arrow pointing inwards. This creates an intuitive understanding of an action where something moves into a space.

examples.chinese: 他已经进入(他已經進入)房间(房間)了。
examples.english: He has already entered the room.

examples.chinese: 明天我将入(明天我將入)学(學)。
